Legal_Issue: Did the citizenship judge err by strictly applying the physical presence test for residency to the exclusion of the qualitative residency test under s. 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act?
Application_Facts: El Ocla was physically present in Canada for 996 days (short of the 1095-day requirement) but had established strong ties to Canada as a tenured professor.
Decision_Outcome: Appeal allowed; case referred to another citizenship judge for redetermination.
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the citizenship judge's decision and reconsideration of the application.
Court_Ruling: The Federal Court found that the citizenship judge erred by not considering the qualitative test for residency under Re Koo and s. 5(1)(c).
Claimant_Status: Permanent resident applying for Canadian citizenship
Defendant_Behavior: Citizenship judge applied only the quantitative physical presence test and disregarded the qualitative mode of living test.
Grounds_for_Claim: Erroneous legal interpretation and failure to apply established jurisprudence (Re Koo).
Legal_Standard: Correctness standard of review on questions of law.
Assessment_Factor: Centralization of mode of living in Canada, employment stability, community ties.
Procedural_Issue: Improper application of legal test during administrative decision-making.
Evidence_Used: Proof of employment as a tenured professor, duration of physical presence, residential history.
Legal_Provision_Cited: s. 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act, Re Koo
Application_Basis: Residency determination based on both physical presence and qualitative integration into Canadian society.
Evidence_Assessed: Duration of stay, nature of employment, establishment of life in Canada.
Relief_Sought: Overturn of refusal and remittal for proper assessment.
Governing_Rule: Qualitative residency test applies when an applicant has centralized their life in Canada despite falling short of physical presence requirements.
Evidentiary_Deficiency: None found; sufficient evidence of qualitative residency was presented but not considered.
Harm_Assessment: Unfair denial of citizenship due to incorrect legal test.
Cause_Description: El Ocla's citizenship application was rejected due to insufficient physical presence days despite his strong ties to Canada.
Evidence_Handling: Relevant evidence of qualitative residency was submitted but not properly evaluated by the citizenship judge.
Evidence_Issues: Failure to consider non-quantitative evidence of residency.
Residency_Compliance: Physical presence: 996 days; Required: 1095 days; Qualitative centralization present.
Evidence_Assessment: Evidence of tenured academic position and settled life in Canada was sufficient to trigger qualitative analysis.
Decision_Rationale: Legal error occurred by excluding the Re Koo qualitative test when circumstances warranted its use.
Evidentiary_Issues: Overlooked relevant evidence regarding qualitative residency factors.
